evidence.text:
Person A: Do you see a ring on my finger? DO you see a ring on my finger?
Person A: Exactly.
Person A: Okay, what's up with all these questions? Fine! I fucked up. I broke the contract. But I will happily sign a new one when we get home...
Person A: Mm... So ex-husband, ex-co- worker... are we even?
Person A: Yes. I'll sign the contract again.

Person B: I don't know his name. We were having fun on the dance floor, I asked him if he wanted to go somewhere else. He said yes. We walked out, all that stuff with Ray happened. So, you know what, if he said his name, I didn't hear it.
Person B: Hey, fuck off. I'm a grown woman. I'm single, and he wasn't random. He was a damn good dancer.

Person B: I was literally just telling the lovely Madison that I was going to be fine with whatever way it went this afternoon. If it all blew up in your face, well, at least I'd get my job back.
Person B: This is where you'd go "what money, Jasper?" or "money from where?" and then I would say "the dead husband's insurance policy." Okay. This'll be our little understanding, okay? The one that keeps me silent, and you guys out of prison.
Person A: Hey!! Stop. Stay. Babe, sit down. We're gonna hear him out.
Person B: Yeah, babe, you're being a... dick.
